sentences.english: There has always been one major caveat, however, to the research on the fade-out effect.
sentences.chinese: 但是消退效应有一个致命的软肋。

sentences.english: Jinshan conscious weakness found old adversary, joy in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 金山自觉发现了老对头的软肋，心中欣喜。

sentences.english: But that expansionary zeal may turn out to be the firm’s Achilles’ heel.
sentences.chinese: 但是那种膨胀性的热诚或许会成为这家公司的软肋。

sentences.english: Once they sense an employee's soft spot, they pounce on it.
sentences.chinese: 他们嗅到员工的软肋，就会重拳出击。

sentences.english: The street talk a lane to smell a virago conjecture in the soft rib ache beauty lightly crumple.
sentences.chinese: 街谈巷闻泼妇虚拟中，软肋疼痛红颜轻轻揉。

sentences.english: Yet China’s economy still has weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 然而中国经济仍然存在软肋。

sentences.english: Tyra, a teetotaler, said food is her only vice.
sentences.chinese: 泰拉是一个禁酒主义者，她说食物是她唯一的软肋。

definition: short stave of the barrel (which allows the contents to escape)/(fig.) shortcoming/weak point
hard lump in the abdomen (in Chinese medicine)/crux of an issue/main point in an argument/sticking point/deadlock in negotiations
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
